publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3516 Mr Frank McAveety: Kerb Crawling—That the Parliament commends the Scottish Executive’s recent announcement of more objective standards for prosecuting kerb crawling, noting the exceptional work of Glasgow City Council and agencies in combating street prostitution for many years in both the Calton and Glasgow Green areas, and hopes that the problems created by street prostitution continue to be tackled and that all the relevant major agencies work together to reduce the level of street prostitution and to ensure that our local communities are safer places to live and work in.

S2M-3516 Mr Frank McAveety: Kerb Crawling—That the Parliament commends the Scottish Executive’s recent announcement of more objective standards for prosecuting kerb crawling, noting the exceptional work of Glasgow City Council and agencies in combating street prostitution for many years in both the Calton and Glasgow Green areas, and hopes that the problems created by street prostitution continue to be tackled and that all the relevant major agencies work together to reduce the level of street prostitution and to ensure that our local communities are safer places to live and work in.
S2M-3516 Kerb Crawling (lodged on 3 November 2005) Mr Jamie Stone*, Kate Maclean*
S2M-3516 Kerb Crawling (lodged on 3 November 2005) Scott Barrie*, Frances Curran*, Paul Martin*, Jackie Baillie*
S2M-3516 Kerb Crawling (lodged on 3 November 2005) Mr Kenneth Macintosh*
S2M-3516 Kerb Crawling (lodged on 3 November 2005) Trish Godman*, Cathie Craigie*, Donald Gorrie*, Karen Whitefield*
